column4: nobody any ideas why skype refuses to work in Lucid Lynx on I386 system ???

chill: deleting it thru software centre and installing it refuses to install
skype doesn't work for me either. Sound issues, as usual. No playback or recording it seems...
it quites after pressing the enter button
remove via software centre and reinstall seemed best to me
mine stays up and I can dial the echo server, but no sound apart from a few press button noises...
did it fix the problem?
does install says no support for I386 system
can't be true...
it is true
There truly isn't a supported version of skype for i386? Astounding?
not according to software centre in Lucid
could install all other skype progs in Lucid
well, it is 3rd. party software. Is there anything on skype's own site?
nope only till *:10
I installed my (non-working) skype from here: http://www.unixmen.com/linux-tutorials/937-things-to-do-after-installing-ubuntu-1004-lts-lucid-lynx
I'll try that
following message : Package skype is not available, but is referred to by another package.
